alert.note: Alert for Trigg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:43PM EDT until April 05 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR MUHLENBERG...CHRISTIAN...SOUTHEASTERN CALDWELL...MCLEAN...EASTERN TRIGG...CENTRAL TODD...HOPKINS AND EASTERN WEBSTER COUNTIES... At 242 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Madisonville to 8 miles southwest of Crofton to 6 miles north of Big Rock, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hopkinsville, Madisonville, Oak Grove, Central City, Dawson Springs, Cadiz, Elkton, Calhoun, Fort Campbell, Sebree, Earlington, Livermore, Nortonville, Pembroke, Mortons Gap, Crofton, Powderly, Graham, Beech Grove and Greenville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 61 and 92. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 89 and 136. Western Kentucky Parkway between Mile Markers 39 and 59. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 1 and 34. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for western, south central and northwestern Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
